intro: Triphasia diacantha, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
